definition: lit. to speak of two things on the same day (idiom); to mention things on equal terms (often with negatives: you can't mention X at the same time as Y)
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
lit. mustn't speak of two things on the same day (idiom); not to be mentioned in the same breath/incomparable
pinyin: bu4 ke3 tong2 ri4 er2 yu3

definition: lit. mustn't speak of two things on the same day (idiom); not to be mentioned in the same breath/incomparable
pinyin: wei4 ke3 tong2 ri4 er2 yu3

sentences.english: Yeah. But Bob's talent can't to be named on the same day with Carl's.
sentences.chinese: 不錯，但是鮑伯的才智可無法與卡爾同日而語。

sentences.english: However, the regular script then couldn't match that of Jin and Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 然而宋代楷書，卻不能與晉唐楷書同日而語了。

sentences.english: But the unlucky beast's defences were no match for the raging hippos.
sentences.chinese: 但是這不幸的野獸的防衛豈能和河馬的暴怒同日而語。

sentences.english: Few scientific and technological achievements equal the success of landing men on the moon .
sentences.chinese: 幾乎科技成就能與人類登陸月球同日而語。

sentences.english: This revised edition is incomparable with the earlier ones.
sentences.chinese: 這一修訂本不可與先前的版本同日而語。

sentences.english: People equdined on success in life with the skills of operating computer.
sentences.chinese: 人們把會利用計算機與人生樂成同日而語。

sentences.english: Few scientific and technological achievements equal the success of landing men on the moon.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎沒有科技成就能與人類成功登陸月球同日而語。

sentences.english: But Mr. Vincy was not equally prepared to be patient.
sentences.chinese: 但文西先生的耐心卻不能同日而語。
